words.definition: To adorn something means to make it more beautiful by decorating it.
words.example: Small glass beads adorned the vase.

words.definition: Bliss is a state of complete happiness.
words.example: Every time he sees his girlfriend, he feels a sense of bliss.

words.definition: A butler is the most important male servant in a wealthy house.
words.example: Whenever he needed something, he rang a bell, and the butler appeared.

words.definition: A cramp is a strong pain caused by a muscle after a lot of physical use.
words.example: After the marathon, Jenny got a terrible cramp in her calf muscle.

words.definition: When a building is dilapidated, it is old and in bad condition.
words.example: Paint peeled off of the old dilapidated apartment building.

words.definition: To evoke a memory or emotion means to make it occur.
words.example: The picture evoked memories of when grandmother was a girl.

words.definition: A farewell is an instance of saying goodbye or a way to say it.
words.example: She got on the plane after we said our farewells.

words.definition: A faucet is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas.
words.example: Turn off the faucet so you donâ€™t waste water.

words.definition: Filth is dirt or a dirty condition that is disgusting.
words.example: The old house was filled with filth and dust.

words.definition: A flaw is a mistake or problem that makes something less than perfect.
words.example: The diamond had a small flaw that only an expert could see.

words.definition: To grin means to smile widely.
words.example: He had a big grin on his face when he won the race.

words.definition: Housekeeping is the job of cleaning and taking care of a house or hotel.
words.example: Good housekeeping is important to keep a hotel successful.

words.definition: A mound is a pile of earth, stones, or other material.
words.example: There was a small mound of dirt in the backyard.

words.definition: When a part of your body is numb, you cannot feel anything in it.
words.example: My fingers were numb from the cold.

words.definition: When someone is reckless, they do not think about the dangers of their actions.
words.example: The reckless driver caused a serious accident.

words.definition: Slate is a dark grey rock that can be easily split into thin layers.
words.example: The roof of the old house was made of slate.

words.definition: A stool is a seat with legs but no back or arms.
words.example: He sat on a tall stool at the kitchen counter.

words.definition: A testament to something is proof that it exists or is true.
words.example: The success of the project is a testament to her hard work.

words.definition: Timber is wood that is used for building houses and making furniture.
words.example: The truck was carrying a heavy load of timber.

words.definition: A valve is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas through a pipe.
words.example: The plumber replaced the broken valve in the sink.
